intro: Arctotis melanocycla, commonly known as the black-eyed Susan, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow petals and dark central disk. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Arctotis melanocycla is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
